message.content:
cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with approximation algorithms for inventory problems, which are typically studied in the fields of operations research (cs.RO) and algorithms (cs.DS). The use of set functions and submodularity suggests a connection to game theory (cs.GT) and machine learning (cs.LG). The mention of a discrete time horizon and demand for items suggests a connection to information theory (cs.IT).
